definition: variant of 打把勢|打把势[da3 ba3 shi5]
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
handle
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
type/form/pattern/style
drill (in sword play)/to thrash around/to demonstrate gymnastic skills/to solicit financial help (in an indirect way)/to show off
itinerant entertainer
(of folk artists) to give a performance at a temple fair or on the street etc
to make a living as a traveling performer etc
to get a monkey to perform tricks/to put on a monkey show/to make fun of sb/to tease
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
a sideshow/vaudeville/juggling
(of a performer) to put on a show at an outdoor venue (temple fair, marketplace etc)/(fig.) to enhance sb's reputation/to make a name for oneself
all the trades/people of all trades and professions
to do a handstand
ruffian/hoodlum
second hand clothes
to turn a somersault
to perform a lion dance
acrobatics/entertainment at folk festival
to travel around the country (as itinerant peddler or entertainer)
